result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher A Claudel

records.addlTxt:
11:20 AM Defendant Christopher A Claudel in court.  Attorney Peter C Lloyd c in court for Christopher A Claudel.  Attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Lloyd is requesting an adjournment.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:20 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Christopher A Claudel in court.  Attorney Peter C Lloyd c in court for Christopher A Claudel. 
Not guilty plea to both counts. Bond is continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
3:26 PM Defendant Christopher A Claudel in court.  Attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Officer Foy is sworn in and testifies. Testifies to being an Officer with the Wisconsin Rapids Police Department. Testifies to Officer Jaye conducting a traffic stop due to observing the registration plate did not match the vehicle. Testifies to the defendant being the driver. Testifies to being on scene for this traffic stop. Witness identifies the defendant in court, court recognizes. Testifies to a K-9 sniff being done. Testifies to the K-9 alerting and a search that was conducted. Testifies to the drug paraphernalia and substances found in the vehicle. Testifies to the substances tested and the results. 

Court finds probable cause to believe a felony was committed and the defendant committed it.

Bond is continued.
Arraignment scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on May 24, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
No controlled substances without a valid prescription.

1:57 PM Defendant Christopher A Claudel in court.  Attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court cancels warrant. Signature bond is reinstated w/ the same conditions.
2:20 PM Defendant Christopher A Claudel not in court.  Attorney Jennifer C Zima in court for State of Wisconsin. Court issues warrant for non appearance - body only.
No controlled substances without a valid prescription. $2000
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on May 6, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
9:19 AM Defendant Christopher A Claudel in court.  Attorney Craig Lambert in court for State of Wisconsin.
